perturbation.original_text: Party A and Party B unanimously agree that they will allocate the proceeds generated from cooperation in accordance with thefollowing provisions: Party B shall have the right to charge, on a quarterly basis, the service fee ("Service Fee") from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services, or designate another person to charge Service Fee from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. The total sum of Service Fee shall be equal to the amount of profits gained by Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. Party B shall have the right to adjust the amount of Service Fee at its own discretion, without the prior consent of Party A or its subsidiaries. Party A shall cause its subsidiaries to pay the Service Fee in respect of Party B's Services provided to such subsidiaries.
perturbation.changed_text: Party A and Party B unanimously agree that they will allocate the proceeds generated from cooperation in accordance with the following provisions: Party B shall have the right to charge, on a quarterly basis, the cooperation fee ("Service Fee") from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services, or designate another person to charge the revenue share from Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services. The total sum of revenue share shall be a percentage of the profits gained by Party A or its subsidiaries who have accepted Party B's Services, as determined by Party A. Party B shall only adjust the amount of the cooperation fee with the prior consent of Party A or its subsidiaries. Party A shall cause its subsidiaries to pay the cooperation fee in respect of Party B's Services provided to such subsidiaries.
perturbation.explanation: The terms "Service Fee" and "revenue share" are used interchangeably without clear definition. Initially, the Service Fee is equal to the total profits, and Party B can adjust it. Then, the total sum is defined as a percentage and Party B's ability to adjust is restricted. This creates confusion about how Party B is compensated.

perturbation.original_text: 3. Party B's Services Party B undertakes to provide the following technical consultancy and services to Party A and its subsidiaries in respect of the cooperative business (collectively referred to as "Party B's Services"): 3.1 Research, development, production, test, operation and maintenance, upgrade and other services of relevant technology; 3.2 Development, construction, operation and maintenance, upgrade and other services of relevant internet platform and system; 3.3 Design the relevant tour products plan, and provide relevant training, implementation and upgrade and other services; 3.4 Consultancy services related to sale and promotion of tour products; 3.5 Other services as agreed by the Parties. Party A agrees that Party B may, at its own discretion, provide the aforementioned Party B's Services to Party A and its subsidiaries, or purchase the required services from any third party and provide the services to Party A and its subsidiaries.
perturbation.changed_text: 3. Party B's Services Party B undertakes to provide the following technical consultancy and services to Party A and its subsidiaries in respect of the cooperative business (collectively referred to as "Party B's Offerings"): 3.1 Research, development, production, test, operation and maintenance, upgrade and other services of relevant technology; 3.2 Development, construction, operation and maintenance, upgrade and other services of relevant internet platform and system; 3.3 Design the relevant tour products plan, and provide relevant training, implementation and upgrade and other services; 3.4 Consultancy services related to sale and promotion of tour products; 3.5 Other services as agreed by the Parties. Party A agrees that Party B may, at its own discretion, provide the aforementioned Party B's Services to Party A and its subsidiaries, or purchase the required products from any third party and provide the services to Party A and its subsidiaries.
perturbation.explanation: The introduction of "Party B's Offerings" as a collective term while still referencing "Party B's Services" later in the same paragraph creates confusion as to whether these terms are interchangeable or refer to distinct sets of obligations. In addition, the last sentence now references purchase of "required products" when it was referring to Party B's Services previously. This creates an ambiguity as to if Party B can purchase products.

perturbation.original_text: 12.3 The Parties agree that any and all intellectual property researched and developed, created and invented by the Parties (including their employees) in the course of performance of this Agreement shall be owned by Party B. For the purpose of this Article 12.3, "Intellectual Property" means the patent, patent application right, trademark, service mark, logo, image, trade name, internet domain name, design right, copyright (including copyright of computer software) and moral rights, database right, right of semiconductor design drawing, utility model, proprietary technology and other intellectual property that are registered and unregistered including those that have applied for registration, as well as all other rights or protection methods with same or similar effect on a global scope.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.3 The Parties agree that any and all intellectual property researched and developed, created and invented by the Parties (including their employees) in the course of performance of this Agreement shall be owned by Party B. For the purpose of this Article 12.3, "Assets" means the patent, patent application right, trademark, service mark, logo, image, trade name, internet domain name, design right, copyright (including copyright of computer software) and moral rights, database right, right of semiconductor design drawing, utility model, proprietary technology and other intellectual property that are registered and unregistered including those that have applied for registration, as well as all other rights or protection methods with same or similar effect on a global scope.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the term "Intellectual Property" to "Assets" in the definition part of this clause makes the definition no longer align with the text preceding it. This is an internal contradiction, as it is unclear whether all "intellectual property" now equates to "assets" for the purpose of ownership under this agreement.
